alert.note: Alert for Callahan; Coleman; Runnels; Shackelford; Taylor (Texas) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS San Angelo (Central Texas San Angelo)
info.headline: Severe Thunderstorm Warning issued August 10 at 7:34PM CDT until August 10 at 8:15PM CDT by NWS San Angelo
info.description: The National Weather Service in San Angelo has issued a * Severe Thunderstorm Warning for... Callahan County in west central Texas... Northern Coleman County in west central Texas... Southwestern Shackelford County in west central Texas... Southeastern Taylor County in west central Texas... Runnels County in west central Texas... * Until 815 PM CDT. * At 733 PM CDT, severe thunderstorms were located along a line extending from near Potosi to near Bradshaw to Ballinger Lake, moving southeast at 25 mph. HAZARD...60 mph wind gusts. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Expect damage to roofs, siding, and trees. * Severe thunderstorms will be near... Clyde and Hatchel around 740 PM CDT. Ballinger and Eula around 745 PM CDT. Dudley around 750 PM CDT. Crews and Benoit around 755 PM CDT. Baird around 800 PM CDT. Novice around 805 PM CDT. Oplin around 810 PM CDT. Cross Plains, Putnam, Glen Cove, Silver Valley, Talpa, Rowden, Valera and Atwell around 815 PM CDT. Other locations impacted by these severe thunderstorms include Camp Tonkawa, Us-283 Near The Callahan- Shackelford County Line, Lake Coleman, Ovalo, I-20 Near The Callahan- Eastland County Line, Drasco, Pumphrey, Admiral, Goldsboro and Lake Winters Lake. This includes Interstate 20 between Mile Markers 290 and 323. HAIL THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX HAIL SIZE...<.75 IN WIND THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX WIND GUST...60 MPH
info.instruction: For your protection move to an interior room on the lowest floor of a building.
